list.title: Question 7
list.content: Solve the equationlog⁡5x−log⁡54=2+log⁡53\log_5 x - \log_5 4 = 2 + \log_5 3log5​x−log5​4=2+log5​3forxxx.
list.markScheme:
Using the properties of logarithms, we getlog⁡5x−log⁡54=2+log⁡53log⁡5x−log⁡54=log⁡552+log⁡53log⁡5x4=log⁡5(52⋅3)log⁡5x4=log⁡575x4=75\begin{aligned}
\log_5 x - \log_5 4 &= 2 + \log_5 3 \\[10pt]
\log_5 x - \log_5 4 &= \log_5 5^2 + \log_5 3 \\[8pt]
\log_5\dfrac{x}{4} &= \log_5 (5^2\hspace{-0.2em}\cdot3)  \\[5pt]
\log_5\dfrac{x}{4} &= \log_5 75 \\[5pt]
\dfrac{x}{4} &= 75 \\
\end{aligned}log5​x−log5​4log5​x−log5​4log5​4x​log5​4x​4x​​=2+log5​3=log5​52+log5​3=log5​(52⋅3)=log5​75=75​x=300\hspace{0.55em}\answer{x = 300}x=300​

list.content:
Letf(x)=ex−2f(x) = e^x - 2f(x)=ex−2andg(x)=3x+kg(x) = 3x + kg(x)=3x+k, forx∈Rx \in \mathbb{R}x∈R, wherekkkis a constant.Find(g∘f)(x)(g\circ f)(x)(g∘f)(x).[2]Given thatlim⁡x→−∞(g∘f)(x)=−4\displaystyle \lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} (g\circ f)(x) = -4x→−∞lim​(g∘f)(x)=−4,
find the value ofkkk.[3]
list.markScheme:
We have(g∘f)(x)=g(f(x))=g(ex−2)=3(ex−2)+k=3ex−6+k\begin{aligned}
\hspace{1.8em} (g\circ f)(x) &= g(f(x)) \\[6pt]
&= g(e^x - 2) \\[6pt]
&= 3(e^x - 2) + k \\[6pt]
&\answer{= 3e^x - 6 + k}\end{aligned}(g∘f)(x)​=g(f(x))=g(ex−2)=3(ex−2)+k=3ex−6+k​​We havelim⁡x→−∞(g∘f)(x)=−4lim⁡x→−∞[3ex−6+k]=−43(0)−6+k=−4−6+k=−4\begin{aligned}
\lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty} (g\circ f)(x) &= -4 \hspace{6.9em} \\[4pt]
\lim_{x \rightarrow -\infty}\hspace{-0.2em}\big[3e^x - 6 + k\big] &= -4 \\[4pt]
3(0) - 6 + k &= -4 \\[9pt]
- 6 + k &= -4 \\
\end{aligned}x→−∞lim​(g∘f)(x)x→−∞lim​[3ex−6+k]3(0)−6+k−6+k​=−4=−4=−4=−4​k=2\hspace{0.2em} \answer{k = 2}k=2​

list.title: Question 11
list.content: Write the expression4ln⁡2−ln⁡84\ln 2 - \ln 84ln2−ln8in the form ofln⁡k\ln klnk, wherek∈Zk \in \mathbb{Z}k∈Z.[3]Hence, or otherwise, solve4ln⁡2−ln⁡8=−ln⁡(2x)4\ln 2 - \ln 8 = -\ln (2x)4ln2−ln8=−ln(2x).[3]
list.markScheme:
Using the properties of logarithms, we have4ln⁡2−ln⁡8=ln⁡(24)−ln⁡8=ln⁡16−ln⁡8=ln⁡(168)=ln⁡2\begin{aligned}
4\ln 2 - \ln 8 &= \ln \big(2^4\big) - \ln 8 \\[12pt]
&= \ln 16 - \ln 8 \\[6pt] 
&= \ln\Big(\dfrac{16}{8}\Big) \\[9pt]
& \answer{= \ln 2}\end{aligned}4ln2−ln8​=ln(24)−ln8=ln16−ln8=ln(816​)=ln2​​Replacing the left hand side of the equation withln⁡2\ln 2ln2, we get4ln⁡2−ln⁡8=−ln⁡(2x)ln⁡2=−ln⁡(2x)−ln⁡2=ln⁡(2x)ln⁡(2−1)=ln⁡(2x)2x=2−12x=12x=14\begin{aligned}
4\ln 2 - \ln 8 &= -\ln (2x) \\[12pt]
\ln 2  &= -\ln(2x) \hspace{2.2em} \\[12pt]
-\ln 2 &= \ln(2x) \\[12pt]
\ln \big(2^{-1}\big) &= \ln(2x) \\[12pt]
2x &= 2^{-1} \\[12pt]
2x &= \dfrac 1 2 \\[13pt]
&\hspace{-0.525em} \answer{x = \dfrac{1}{4}}\end{aligned}4ln2−ln8ln2−ln2ln(2−1)2x2x​=−ln(2x)=−ln(2x)=ln(2x)=ln(2x)=2−1=21​x=41​​​

list.title: Question 18
list.content: Solvelog⁡6(x)+log⁡6(x−5)=2\log_6(x) + \log_6(x-5) = 2log6​(x)+log6​(x−5)=2, forx>5x > 5x>5.
list.markScheme:
Using the properties of logarithms, we getlog⁡6(x)+log⁡6(x−5)=2log⁡6(x(x−5))=log⁡662log⁡6(x2−5x)=log⁡636x2−5x=36x2−5x−36=0(x+4)(x−9)=0x−9=0[sincex+4>0]\begin{aligned}
\log_6(x) + \log_6(x-5) &= 2 \\[6pt]
\log_6(x(x-5)) &= \log_6 6^2 \\[5pt]
\log_6 (x^2-5x) &= \log_6 36 \\[5pt]
x^2-5x &= 36 \\[5pt]

\end{aligned}g(g−1(x))g(y)21​−ln(y2−4​)ln(y2−4​)y2−4​y2−4y2y​=x=x=x=21​−x=e(21​−x)=e2(21​−x)=e1−2x+4=e1−2x+4​​Hence an expression forg−1g^{-1}g−1isg−1(x)=e1−2x+4\answer{g^{-1}(x) = \sqrt{e^{1 - 2x} + 4}}g−1(x)=e1−2x+4​​The domain ofg−1g^{-1}g−1isR\answer{\mathbb{R}}R​

x &= \ln 2\end{aligned}[2ex][ex−2]ex−2exx​=0=0=2=ln2​Hence we finda=ln⁡2\answer{a = \ln 2}a=ln2​If we solve the equation(f∘f−1)(x)=x(f\circ f^{-1})(x) = x(f∘f−1)(x)=xfory=f−1(x)y =  f^{-1}(x)y=f−1(x), we obtainf(f−1(x))=x[where−2≤x<2]f(y)=x[wherey≤ln⁡2]e2y−4ey+2=x[(ey)2−4ey]+2=x[(ey−2)2−4]+2=x[by completing the square](ey−2)2=x+2ey−2=±x+2ey−2=−x+2[sincey≤ln⁡2]ey=2−x+2y=ln⁡(2−x+2)\begin{aligned}

y &= \ln (2-\sqrt{x+2})\end{aligned}f(f−1(x))f(y)e2y−4ey+2[(ey)2−4ey]+2[(ey−2)2−4]+2(ey−2)2ey−2ey−2eyy​=x[where−2≤x<2]=x[wherey≤ln2]=x=x=x[by completing the square]=x+2=±x+2​=−x+2​[sincey≤ln2]=2−x+2​=ln(2−x+2​)​Hence we findf−1(x)=ln⁡(2−x+2),forx∈R,−2≤x<2\answer{f^{-1}(x) = \ln (2-\sqrt{x+2}), \text{ for } x \in \mathbb{R}, -2 \leq x < 2}f−1(x)=ln(2−x+2​),forx∈R,−2≤x<2​
